questions.text: What is the main goal of content marketing?
options: To provide value that attracts and educates your audience, building trust over time
To get as many page views as possible
questions.explanation: Content marketing focuses on creating valuable, relevant content that attracts and educates your target audience. Rather than directly pitching products, you build trust and authority. Sales become a natural outcome of the relationship you've built.

questions.text: What is a 'content pillar' in content strategy?
options: A physical column in your office
A core topic or theme around which you create multiple pieces of content
The first blog post you write
A type of social media post
questions.explanation: Content pillars are core topics aligned with your expertise and audience interests. Each pillar becomes a foundation for multiple content pieces (blogs, videos, podcasts, etc.), helping you build authority in specific areas while maintaining focus.

questions.text: What is the 'content distribution rule' often cited in marketing?
questions.explanation: The 80/20 rule suggests spending 20% of your time creating content and 80% promoting it. Many creators do the opposite, but great content without distribution won't reach anyone. Promotion through multiple channels is crucial for content marketing success.
